SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.vincestyling.asqliteplus.statement
Class Statement

java.lang.Object
  com.vincestyling.asqliteplus.statement.Statement
Direct Known Subclasses:
CreateStatement, DeleteStatement, QueryStatement, UpdateStatement
public class Statement
extends java.lang.Object

A base class for constructing SQL statement. Internal holding a StringBuilder to representing the SQL statement. Exposed many elegant methods to concatenating those acceptable clauses finally complete the entire SQL statement.

A Statement look as a String, only its toString() matter, just make sure that the toString() method would return the final SQL statement you want to be executing.

Note: 'Cause this series of statement producer would never understand about the SQL syntax, therefore this assumes you have a basic knowledge of SQL programming, you need to decide which clause can be join together without syntax errors while performing and which cannot.

See Also:
DBOverseer

from

public Statement from(java.lang.Object... tables)
Appending the FROM clause with one or more table name.

Parameters:
tables - the names of the table to operating. Each name can be either a normal String which just the table name or wrapped the table name's Alias object.
Returns:
this statement.

where

public Statement where(java.lang.Object operand)
Appending the WHERE clause.

Parameters:
operand - the condition operand. Usually be a normal String which just the column name or wrapped the column name's Function||Scoping object. It can also be an Exists||NotExists object which carry the (NOT)EXISTS clause.
Returns:
this statement.

append

public Statement append(java.lang.Object value)
A safe way to appending a value if instance of String, include quoting the String value. In order to preventing SQL injection, also escaping that String value which may contain single quotes.

Note: you can wrapping a String as UnescapeString to avoiding this behaviors.

Parameters:
value - the raw value to be append, would translate to String["null"] if being null.
Returns:
this statement.

append

protected void append(java.lang.StringBuilder statement,
                      java.lang.Object value)
A safe way to appending a value if instance of String, include quoting the String value. In order to preventing SQL injection, also escaping that String value which may contain single quotes.

Note: you can wrapping a String as UnescapeString to avoiding this behaviors.

Parameters:
statement - the StringBuilder that the SQL statement will be appended to.
value - the raw value to be append, would translate to String["null"] if being null.

appendClauses

protected void appendClauses(java.lang.Object... clauses)
Concatenates all the given clauses, separating them with commas.

Parameters:
clauses - the list of clause. Each clause usually a table name or column name, and each name can be either a normal String which just the name or wrapped the name's Alias||Function||Scoping object.

copy

public Statement copy()
Simply clone this Statement by create a new Statement which apply the original statement.

Returns:
the new statement.
